tagline: HTML template engine based on native Javascript
body:
## Getting started Install via NPM... ``` $ npm install jml ``` ... or add script to your web page. ```html ``` ## Simple usage ```javascript jml.render([['div.container', ['a.link', {_href: 'http://tenphi.com'}, 'Link text'], ['img.image', {_src: '/myphoto.jpg', _alt: '', width: '100px'}] ]]); ``` output (with beautifying): ```html
Link text
``` ## Render container Parameters order is strict: * tag name * id * classes Example: `['a#id.class.second-class']` ## Options for render Render function can accept options: ```javascript var link = [function() { return ['a', {_href: this.url}].concat(this.body); }]; var options = { url: 'http://tenphi.com', body: 'Link Text' }; jml.render([link], options); ``` ## Advanced usage with Templates Add template: ```javascript jml.view('Link', [['a', {_href: 'url'}, 'Link Text']]); ``` then render it: ```javascript jml.render([['div.container', ['Link']]]); ``` ### Template options Rewrite template: ```javascript jml.view('Link', [[function() { return ['a', {_href: this.url}].concat(this.body); }]]); ``` and render it with options: ```javascript jml.render([['div.container', ['Link', { url: 'http://tenphi.com', body: 'Link Text' }]]]); ``` ## JML Tools There are several function-tools for JML: * `jml.prop(name)` - return property `name` ```javascript var template = [['a', {_href: 'http://tenphi.com'}, jml.prop('content')]]; jml.render(template, {content: 'Link Text'}); ``` full documentation will be soon
